cards.name: Castle
cards.text: Untapped creatures you control get +0/+2.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Artifacts
cards.text: {2}: The next time an artifact source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Black
cards.text: {1}: The next time a black source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Circle of Protection: Blue
cards.text: {1}: The next time a blue source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.text: {1}: The next time a green source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.text: {1}: The next time a red source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage.

rulings.text: A source of damage is a permanent, a spell on the stack (including one that creates a permanent), or any object referred to by an object on the stack. A source doesn’t need to be capable of dealing damage to be a legal choice.
Can be used even when there is no damage to prevent. It prevents the next damage (if any) from the source this turn.

cards.name: Conversion
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, sacrifice Conversion unless you pay {W}{W}.
All Mountains are Plains.

rulings.text: The Conversion effect is a continuous effect. There is no chance to tap a just-played mountain for red mana before it becomes a plains.
Will not add or remove Snow Supertype to or from a land.

cards.name: Crusade
cards.text: White creatures get +1/+1.

cards.name: Death Ward
cards.text: Regenerate target creature.

cards.name: Disenchant
cards.text: Destroy target artifact or enchantment.

rulings.text: This is not modal. If the target changes from an artifact to an enchantment or vice versa, this still destroys it.

Enchant creature

cards.name: Elder Land Wurm

Defender, trample
When Elder Land Wurm blocks, it loses defender.

rulings.text: Another effect can give Elder Land Wurm defender after it has lost it. Blocking again will cause it to lose that instance of defender too.

foreignNames.name: 老いたるランド・ワーム

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

cards.name: Fortified Area
cards.text: Wall creatures you control get +1/+0 and have banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

cards.name: Green Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

cards.name: Holy Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can’t use the same draw to do other things.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
It affects all opponents.
Does not affect cards that phase in.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the “Snow-Covered” lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an “intervening ‘if’ clause.” That means (1) the ability won’t trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don’t put any basic land cards into your hand.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Morale
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.

cards.name: Osai Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only gets one counter per turn, not one per creature.

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent’s Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

cards.name: Piety
cards.text: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.

If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

cards.name: Seeker
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature’s power is negative, its controller doesn’t lose or gain life.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)

cards.name: Visions
cards.text: Look at the top five cards of target player's library. You may then have that player shuffle that library.

rulings.text: You can’t rearrange the cards. You put them back in the same order or have the whole library shuffled.
If there are less than 5 cards in the library, you look at whatever ones remain and you still get the option to shuffle.
This is not a draw and will not cause a player to lose if there are less than 5 cards in the library.

Defender (This creature can't attack.)

foreignNames.text: Ein Spieler Deiner Wahl erhält X Lebenspunkte dazu, oder verhindere bis zu X Schadenspunkte bei einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler.

cards.originalText: Give target player X life, or prevent X damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Amrou Kithkin
cards.text: Amrou Kithkin can't be blocked by creatures with power 3 or greater.
cards.flavor: Quick and agile, Amrou Kithkin can usually escape from even the most fearsome opponents.

rulings.text: A creature with power 3 or greater can’t be declared as a blocker for Amrou Kithkin. If the power of a creature that’s already blocking Amrou Kithkin is increased to 3 or greater, it will continue to block Amrou Kithkin.

foreignNames.name: Amrou Kithkin
foreignNames.text: Keine Kreatur mit einer Stärke größer als 2 kann Kithkin blocken.

cards.originalText: No creature with power greater than 2 may be assigned to block Kithkin.

cards.name: Angry Mob
cards.text:
Trample
As long as it's your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each equal to 2 plus the number of Swamps your opponents control. As long as it's not your turn, Angry Mob's power and toughness are each 2.

foreignNames.name: Aufgebrachter Pöbel
foreignNames.text:
Verursacht Trampelschaden
Während Deines Zuges hat der aufgebrachte Pöbel Stärke und Widerstandskraft von 2 plus der Anzahl der Sümpfe, die Deine Gegner im Spiel haben. Während den Zügen Deiner Gegner hat der Pöbel Stärke und Widerstandskraft 2/2.

cards.originalText:
Trample
During your turn, Angry Mob has power and toughness each equal to 2 plus the total number of swamps opponents control. During other turns, Angry Mob has power and toughness 2/2.

cards.name: Animate Wall
cards.text:
Enchant Wall
Enchanted Wall can attack as though it didn't have defender.

rulings.text: This is a change from the most recent wording. As was the case in the past, Animate Wall can now enchant only a Wall.

foreignNames.name: Mauerbelebung
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Mauer kann nun auch angreifen.

cards.originalText: Target wall can now attack.

cards.name: Armageddon
cards.text: Destroy all lands.

foreignNames.name: Götterdämmerung
foreignNames.text: Vernichte alle Länder im Spiel.

cards.originalText: Destroy all lands.

cards.name: Balance
cards.text: Each player chooses a number of lands they control equal to the number of lands controlled by the player who controls the fewest, then sacrifices the rest. Players discard cards and sacrifice creatures the same way.

rulings.text: First the player whose turn it is chooses which lands (if any) to keep, then each other player in turn order does the same. Each player will know the choices made by the players who chose before them. All of the unchosen lands are then sacrificed simultaneously. Then the process is repeated for cards in hand, except that no cards are revealed until all players have chosen what to discard, at which point those cards are all discarded simultaneously. Lastly, the process is repeated for creatures, and players will again know earlier choices made when deciding what to sacrifice. All of the unchosen creatures are then sacrificed simultaneously.
Balance doesn’t have targets, so permanents that can’t be targeted, such as a creature with shroud or protection from white, are valid choices to be sacrificed.

Each type of object is counted during the corresponding part of the process. Cards in hand are counted after lands have been sacrificed, and creatures on the battlefield are counted after cards have been discarded. Thus, a land creature sacrificed to the first part of the spell would not be counted when determining how many creatures are on the battlefield for the last part.

cards.originalText: Each player sacrifices enough lands to equalize the number of lands all players control. The player who controls the fewest lands cannot sacrifice any in this way. All players then equalize cards in hand and then creatures in play in the same way.

cards.name: Benalish Hero
cards.text: Banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Benalia has a complex caste system that changes with the lunar year. No matter what the season, the only caste that cannot be attained by either heredity or money is that of the Hero.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't attack unless its controller pays {3}.

rulings.text: This ability is paid for during the declare attackers step of the combat phase.

cards.name: Eye for an Eye
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, instead that source deals that much damage to you and Eye for an Eye deals that much damage to that source's controller.

rulings.text: The damage dealt to you is still being dealt by the original source. The damage dealt to the other player is being dealt by Eye for an Eye.
Eye for an Eye must resolve before damage would be dealt to you in order to affect that damage.

foreignNames.name: Auge um Auge
foreignNames.text: Du kannst diesen Zauber nur sprechen, wenn Dir eine Kreatur, ein Zauberspruch oder ein Effekt Schaden zufügt. Auge um Auge fügt dem Beherrscher dieser Kreatur, dieses Zauberspruchs oder Effekts denselben Schaden zu. Sollte irgendein Zauberspruch oder Effekt den Schaden, den Du erhältst, reduzieren, dann berührt das den Schaden, der von Auge um Auge erzeugt wird, allerdings nicht.

cards.originalText: You may cast Eye for an Eye only when a creature, spell, or effect deals damage to you. Eye for an Eye deals an equal amount of damage to the controller of that creature, spell, or effect. If another spell or effect reduces the amount of damage you receive, it does not reduce the damage dealt by Eye for an Eye.

cards.name: Fortified Area
cards.text: Wall creatures you control get +1/+0 and have banding. (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)

foreignNames.name: Befestigtes Gebiet
foreignNames.text: Alle Mauern unter Deiner Kontrolle gewinnen Bündnisfähigkeit und erhalten +1/+0

cards.originalText: All walls you control gain banding and get +1/+0.

cards.name: Green Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from green. This effect doesn't remove Green Ward.

foreignNames.name: Grüner Schutz
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält Schutz vor Grün. Dieser Schutz zerstört allerdings diese Verzauberung nicht.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from green. The protection granted by Green Ward does not destroy Green Ward.

cards.name: Healing Salve
cards.text:
Choose one —
• Target player gains 3 life.
• Prevent the next 3 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.

foreignNames.name: Heilbalsam
foreignNames.text: Gib einem Spieler Deiner Wahl 3 Lebenspunkte, oder verhindere bis zu 3 Schadenspunkte bei einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler.

cards.originalText: Give target player 3 life, or prevent up to 3 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Holy Armor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +0/+2.
{W}: Enchanted creature gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

foreignNames.name: Heilige Rüstung
foreignNames.text:
Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +0/+2.
{W}: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +0/+1 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText:
Target creature gets +0/+2.
ooW Target creature Holy Armor enchants gets +0/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Holy Strength
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +1/+2.

foreignNames.name: Heilige Stärke
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält +1/+2.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +1/+2.

cards.name: Island Sanctuary
cards.text: If you would draw a card during your draw step, instead you may skip that draw. If you do, until your next turn, you can't be attacked except by creatures with flying and/or islandwalk.

rulings.text: If you get multiple draws or you use a spell or ability during the draw step to draw extra cards, you can have the replacement effect apply to any one or all of those. You need only have it apply once to get the effect. If you skip more than one, there is no additional effect.
If the replacement effect is applied, the effect will continue until your next turn even if this card leaves the battlefield.
Since the draw is replaced, you can’t use the same draw to do other things.

foreignNames.name: Inselheiligtum
foreignNames.text: Während Deiner Kartenziehphase kannst Du Dich entscheiden, eine Karte weniger als sonst zu ziehen. Wenn Du das tust, können Dich bis zum Beginn Deines nächsten Zuges nur Kreaturen mit Flugfähigkeit oder Inseltarnung attackieren.

cards.originalText: During your draw phase, you may draw one less card from your library. If you do so, until start of your next turn the only creatures that can attack you are those with flying or islandwalk.

cards.name: Karma
cards.text: At the beginning of each player's upkeep, Karma deals damage to that player equal to the number of Swamps they control.

rulings.text: Amount of damage is determined when the ability resolves and not when it is placed on the stack.

foreignNames.name: Karma
foreignNames.text: Karma fügt jedem Spieler während seiner Versorgungsphase pro Sumpf, den der jeweilige Spieler im Spiel hat, ein Schadenspunkt zu.

cards.originalText: During each player's upkeep, Karma deals 1 damage to that player for each swamp he or she controls.

cards.name: Kismet
cards.text: Artifacts, creatures, and lands your opponents control enter the battlefield tapped.

rulings.text: Cards enter the battlefield tapped. They do not enter the battlefield untapped and then immediately tap, therefore they do not trigger any effects due to tapping.
It affects all opponents.
Does not affect cards that phase in.

foreignNames.name: Kismet
foreignNames.text: Wähle einen Deiner Gegner. Alle Kreaturen, Länder und Artefakte dieses Gegners kommen getappt ins Spiel.

cards.originalText: All of target player's creatures, lands, and artifacts come into play tapped.

cards.name: Land Tax
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, if an opponent controls more lands than you, you may search your library for up to three basic land cards, reveal them, put them into your hand, then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You can fetch any of the “Snow-Covered” lands, since they all also have the supertype basic.

This ability has an “intervening ‘if’ clause.” That means (1) the ability won’t trigger at all unless any one of your opponents controls more lands than you, and (2) the ability will do nothing if you control at least as many lands as each of your opponents by the time it resolves.
You shuffle your library if you search, even if you don’t put any basic land cards into your hand.

foreignNames.name: Grundsteuer
foreignNames.text: Wenn ein Gegner mehr Länder als Du im Spiel hat, kannst Du während Deiner Versorgungsphase Deine Bibliothek durchsuchen und bis zu drei Standardländer auf Deine Hand nehmen. Mische Deine Bibliothek danach gründlich.

cards.originalText: During your upkeep, if an opponent controls more land than you, you may search your library and remove up to three basic land cards and put them into your hand. Reshuffle your library afterwards.

cards.name: Mesa Pegasus
cards.text: Flying; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor: Before a woman marries in the village of Sursi, she must visit the land of the Mesa Pegasus. Legend has it that if the woman is pure of heart and her love is true, a Mesa Pegasus will appear, blessing her family with long life and good fortune.

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

foreignNames.name: Mesa-Pegasus
foreignNames.text: Kann fliegen, Bündnisfähigkeit

cards.originalText: Flying, banding

cards.name: Morale
cards.text: Attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"After Lacjsi's speech, the Knights grew determined to crush their ancient enemies clan by clan."
—Tivadar of Thorn, *History of the Goblin Wars*

foreignNames.name: Moral
foreignNames.text: Alle angreifenden Kreaturen erhalten +1/+1 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: All attacking creatures get +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Northern Paladin
cards.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Destroy target black permanent.
cards.flavor:
"Look to the north; there you will find aid and comfort."
—The Book of Tal

foreignNames.name: Nordischer Paladin
foreignNames.text: {W}{W}, {T}: Vernichte eine schwarze bleibende Karte.

cards.originalText: oWoW, ocT: Destroy target black permanent.

cards.name: Osai Vultures
cards.text:
Flying
At the beginning of each end step, if a creature died this turn, put a carrion counter on Osai Vultures.
Remove two carrion counters from Osai Vultures: Osai Vultures gets +1/+1 until end of turn.

rulings.text: Only gets one counter per turn, not one per creature.

cards.originalText:
Flying
At the end of any turn in which a creature is put into the graveyard from play, put a carrion counter on Vultures.
o0: Remove two carrion counters to give Vultures +1/+1 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pearled Unicorn
cards.flavor:
"'Do you know, I always thought Unicorns were fabulous monsters, too? I never saw one alive before!' 'Well, now that we have seen each other,' said the Unicorn, 'if you'll believe in me, I'll believe in you.'"
—Lewis Carroll

cards.name: Personal Incarnation
cards.text:
{0}: The next 1 damage that would be dealt to Personal Incarnation this turn is dealt to its owner instead. Only Personal Incarnation's owner may activate this ability.
When Personal Incarnation dies, its owner loses half their life, rounded up.

rulings.text: You do not lose life if this card is exiled or sent someplace without going to the graveyard first.
The owner of the Incarnation loses life when it is destroyed, not the controller. So if you control your opponent’s Incarnation you can let it die to make them lose life.
If you attempt to halve a negative life total, you halve 0. This means that the life total stays the same. A life total of -10 would remain -10.

foreignNames.name: Eigene Inkarnation
foreignNames.text:
Der Beherrscher kann Teile oder den ganzen Schaden, der der Inkarnation zugefügt werden, auf sich selber umleiten.
Wird die Inkarnation vernichtet, verliert ihr Beherrscher die (aufgerundete) Hälfte seiner Lebenspunkte. Effekte, die Schaden verhindern oder umleiten, können hier nicht angewendet werden, um diesen Verlust an Lebenspunkten zu verhindern.

cards.originalText: Owner may redirect any or all damage done to Personal Incarnation to self instead. If Personal Incarnation is put into the graveyard from play, owner loses half his or her remaining life, rounding up the loss. Effects that redirect or prevent damage cannot be used to counter this loss of life.

cards.name: Piety
cards.text: Blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"Whoever obeys God and His Prophet, fears God and does his duty to Him, will surely find success."
—*The Qur'an, 24:52*

foreignNames.name: Frömmigkeit
foreignNames.text: Alle blockenden Kreaturen erhalten +0/+3 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: All blocking creatures get +0/+3 until end of turn.

cards.name: Pikemen
cards.text: First strike; banding (Any creatures with banding, and up to one without, can attack in a band. Bands are blocked as a group. If any creatures with banding you control are blocking or being blocked by a creature, you divide that creature's combat damage, not its controller, among any of the creatures it's being blocked by or is blocking.)
cards.flavor:
"As the cavalry bore down, we faced them with swords drawn and pikes hidden in the grass at our feet. 'Don't lift your pikes 'til I give the word,' I said."
—Maeveen O'Donagh, Memoirs of a Soldier

rulings.text: If a creature with banding attacks, it can team up with any number of other attacking creatures with banding (and up to one nonbanding creature) and attack as a unit called a “band.” The band can be blocked by any creature that could block a single creature in the band. Blocking any creature in a band blocks the entire band. If a creature with banding is blocked, the attacking player chooses how the blockers’ damage is assigned.
A maximum of one nonbanding creature can join an attacking band no matter how many creatures with banding are in it.
Creatures in the same band must all attack the same player or planeswalker.
If a creature in combat has banding, its controller assigns damage for creatures blocking or blocked by it. That player can ignore the damage assignment order when making this assignment.

foreignNames.name: Spießträger
foreignNames.text: Bündnisfähigkeit, Erstschlag

cards.originalText: Banding, first strike

cards.name: Purelace
cards.text: Target spell or permanent becomes white. (Mana symbols on that permanent remain unchanged.)

foreignNames.name: Reinheitsgewebe
foreignNames.text: Die Farbe einer entweder sich im Spiel befindlichen oder gerade gespielten Karte verändert sich in Weiß. Völlig unberührt davon bleiben der Gebrauch einer bestimmten Fähigkeit und die Kosten des Zauberns, des Tappens oder der Versorgung des Ziels.

cards.originalText: Change the color of target spell or target permanent to white. Costs to cast, tap, maintain, or use a special ability of target remain unchanged.

cards.name: Red Ward
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has protection from red. This effect doesn't remove Red Ward.

foreignNames.name: Roter Schutz
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur erhält Schutz gegen Rot. Dieser Schutz zerstört allerdings diese Verzauberung nicht.

cards.originalText: Target creature gains protection from red. The protection granted by Red Ward does not destroy Red Ward.

cards.name: Reverse Damage
cards.text: The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent that damage. You gain life equal to the damage prevented this way.

rulings.text: It only affects damage dealt by the source one time. If the source damages you a second time this turn, the damage will not be reversed.

foreignNames.name: Umkehrschaden
foreignNames.text: Aller Schaden, den Du bislang in diesem Zug von einer bestimmten Quelle erhalten hast, wird zu Deinen Lebenspunkten hinzuaddiert statt abgezogen. Wenn Du in diesem Zug noch weiteren Schaden aus dieser Quelle erhältst, wird dieser ganz normal behandelt.

cards.originalText: All damage dealt to you so far this turn by one source is retroactively added to your life total instead of subtracted. Further damage this turn is treated normally.

cards.name: Righteousness
cards.text: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

rulings.text: A “blocking creature” is one that has been declared as a blocker this combat, or one that was put onto the battlefield blocking this combat. Unless that creature leaves combat, it continues to be a blocking creature through the end of combat step, even if the creature or creatures it was blocking are no longer on the battlefield or have otherwise left combat.

foreignNames.name: Rechtschaffenheit
foreignNames.text: Ein blockende Kreatur Deiner Wahl erhält +7/+7 bis zum Ende des Zuges.

cards.originalText: Target blocking creature gets +7/+7 until end of turn.

cards.name: Samite Healer
cards.text: {T}: Prevent the next 1 damage that would be dealt to any target this turn.
cards.flavor: Healers ultimately acquire the divine gifts of spiritual and physical wholeness. The most devout are also granted the ability to pass physical wholeness on to others.

foreignNames.name: Feldscher
foreignNames.text: {T}: Verhindere einen Schadenspunkt bei einer Kreatur oder einem Spieler.

cards.originalText: ocT: Prevent 1 damage to any creature or player.

cards.name: Savannah Lions
cards.flavor: The traditional kings of the jungle command a healthy respect in other climates as well. Relying mainly on their stealth and speed, Savannah Lions can take a victim by surprise, even in the endless, flat plains of their homeland.

cards.name: Seeker
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature can't be blocked except by artifact creatures and/or white creatures.

foreignNames.name: Suchender
foreignNames.text: Die verzauberte Kreatur kann nur von weißen und Artefaktkreaturen geblockt werden.

cards.originalText: Target creature cannot be blocked except by white creatures and artifact creatures.

cards.name: Serra Angel
cards.text: Flying, vigilance
cards.flavor: Born with wings of light and a sword of faith, this heavenly incarnation embodies both fury and purity.

foreignNames.name: Serra-Engel
foreignNames.text:
Kann fliegen.
Der Serra Engel wird beim Angreifen nicht getappt.

cards.originalText:
Flying
Attacking does not cause Serra Angel to tap.

cards.name: Spirit Link
cards.text:
Enchant creature (Target a creature as you cast this. This card enters the battlefield attached to that creature.)
Whenever enchanted creature deals damage, you gain that much life.

rulings.text: You only gain the life when the triggered ability resolves. If you are reduced to zero life before the ability resolves, you will lose before gaining the life.

You gain life for all damage which is not prevented, regardless of what the creature damages (player or another creature) or the toughness of the blocking creature. If you put this on a 5/5 and it is blocked by a 1/1, you still gain 5 life.

foreignNames.name: Geisteskontakt
foreignNames.text: Du gewinnst 1 Lebenspunkt für jeden Schadenspunkt, den die verzauberte Kreatur beliebigen Gegnern zufügt. Du kannst dabei sogar mehr Lebenspunkte gewinnen als die angegriffene Kreatur Widerstandskraft bzw. der Spieler Lebenspunkte besitzt.

cards.originalText: Gain 1 life for every 1 damage target creature deals. You may gain more life than the toughness or the total life of the creature or player damaged by the creature Spirit Link enchants.

cards.name: Swords to Plowshares
cards.text: Exile target creature. Its controller gains life equal to its power.

rulings.text: The amount of life gained is equal to the power of the targeted creature as it last existed on the battlefield.
If the creature’s power is negative, its controller doesn’t lose or gain life.

foreignNames.name: Schwerter zu Pflugscharen
foreignNames.text: Nimm eine Kreatur ganz aus dem Spiel. Ihr Beherrscher erhält dafür so viele Lebenspunkte, wie die Kreatur Stärke hatte.

cards.originalText: Remove target creature from the game. The creature's controller gains life equal to its power.

cards.name: Tundra Wolves
cards.text: First strike (This creature deals combat damage before creatures without first strike.)
cards.flavor: I heard their eerie howling, the wolves calling their kindred across the frozen plains.

foreignNames.name: Tundrawölfe
foreignNames.text: Erstschlag

cards.originalText: First strike
